p: The difference between the two species is difficult to explain. Black grouse females are about half the size of capercaillie females. They nest a few days later, nests are better camouflaged, females sit tighter on the eggs during incubation, and nest loss is lower than in capercaillie [ 35]. Thus, incubating black grouse may be less sensitive than capercaillie to changes in predation pressure. In addition, the tendency of higher survival of chicks in recent years might be related to better adult nutrition prior to hatching due to advanced plant phenology [ 15].
